body:
Comment 9 by **lucio.dere**: 
I have no idea if my problem is related, but I've been getting frequent stalls on
execution of a fairly trivial SPAM message parser on a Plan 9 native implementation of
Go for a project I'm involved with.

Even interrupting execution did not have the desired effect immediately, although
peeking from another window sometimes released the blocked program, sometimes caused the
new window to block too.  I never quite needed to reset the system, though.

Stats suggested that the system was load-saturated, but I never dug any deeper, leaving
that for when the utility is complete.

If this is not a familiar situation for anyone else (I'm running a fairly stock Bell
Labs distribution), then I'll report it separately when I start investigating it
properly.

Lucio.
